item.title: Take-Two CEO Says GenAI Has Zero Part In GTA 6
item.content:encoded:
The CEO of Take-Two Interactive has confirmed that no generative AI is used in Grand Theft Auto 6.

During a recent interview with GamesIndustry.biz, Take-Two Interactive CEO Strauss Zelnick discussed his take on generative AI, stating that while he is personally enthusiastic about the technology and its practical uses in terms of saving time and money, he does not believe these tools can create great entertainment on their own and affirms that there is no generative AI usage in the upcoming release in the Grand Theft Auto franchise.

He would go so far as to say that GenAI has no part in what Rockstar is building and that the worlds are handcrafted.

“Specifically with regards to GTA 6, Generative AI has zero part in what Rockstar Games is building. Their worlds are handcrafted. That’s what differentiates them,” he said.

GTA 6 Will Have a Physical Release

In debunking a rumor, Take-Two confirmed in its quarterly earnings report that Grand Theft Auto 6 will have a physical release. Also, marketing is slated to begin this summer. The game remains on track for release on November 19, despite several delays.

Generative AI is on the rise in gaming. PlayStation recently announced plans to use the technology to create podcasts featuring video game characters. Learn more about that here.

How do you feel about the Take-Two CEO’s strong stance on AI in Grand Theft Auto 6? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

In its latest earnings report, Take-Two Interactive confirmed that Grand Theft Auto 6 (GTA 6) marketing will start this summer.

item.title: AMD Says Next Xbox Console May Launch Next Year
item.content:encoded:
An update on when the next Xbox console could come home to players.

During AMD’s Q4 2025 earnings call, CEO Dr. Lisa Su provided an update on the potential launch window for the next-generation Xbox. Su stated, “Development of Microsoft’s next-gen Xbox featuring an AMD semi-custom SoC [system-on-a-chip] is progressing well to support a launch in 2027.”

The potential launch timing was mentioned during a discussion of AMD’s semi-custom chip business, which includes video game consoles. She said annual revenue from that segment is expected to decline in 2026 by a “significant double-digit percentage.”

The Relationship Between AMD and Xbox Explained

In 2025, Microsoft announced that it was working with AMD on its next-generation console. This is all part of a multi-year partnership.

At that time, Su stated that AMD would go above and beyond by building custom chips for Xbox Hardware and planned to create a “full roadmap of gaming optimized chips, combining the power of Ryzen and Radeon for consoles, handhelds, PCs, and the cloud.”

In other AMD news, the company is raising the price of its graphics cards to offset rising memory costs. Learn more about that here.

The next PlayStation console is also rumored to be launching in 2027. How do you feel about the next generation of Xbox consoles? Do you feel this generation has been fully leveraged? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: GTA 5 Has Sold 225 Million Copies
item.content:encoded:
Believe it or not, they’ve sold even more copies of GTA 5.

In its latest quarterly earnings release, Take-Two Interactive revealed that Grand Theft Auto 5 has sold 225 million copies. This is an increase from its last report, which noted the game had sold up to 220 million copies.

Grand Theft Auto 5 has been available since 2013 and has been released across three console generations and PC.

Financial News Regarding the Impact of Grand Theft Auto Online

In the earnings, they expect recurrent customer spending growth of 17% year over year, assuming Grand Theft Auto Online spending increases. Also, the RCS rose 23% in the quarter overall, with Grand Theft Auto Online rising 27% alone. Grand Theft Auto Online continues to put out new content regularly. However, all eyes remain on the impending release of Grand Theft Auto 6.

GTA 6 is slated to release in November 2026. Take-Two Interactive reaffirmed the release date in its latest quarterly earnings filing. While waiting for GTA 6, a recent rumor that the game would not receive a physical release has been debunked.

How many times have you purchased GTA 5? What is your preferred platform to play the game on? How eager are you to move on to Grand Theft Auto 6? Sound off in our official Discord server.

For more from Insider Gaming, learn about the recent decision from Take-Two Interactive to cancel a Nintendo Switch 2 port for Borderlands 4. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Borderlands 4 Nintendo Switch 2 Development Paused by Take-Two
item.content:encoded:
Plans to bring Borderlands 4 to the Nintendo Switch 2 are currently on pause.

Take-Two Interactive is pausing development of Borderlands 4 for Nintendo Switch 2, as stated in its most recent quarterly earnings on Tuesday, February 3.

A spokesperson told Variety that it was a difficult decision to pause development of a Nintendo Switch 2 release for Borderlands 4. However, they say they remain committed to delivering high-quality post-launch content and to working closely with Nintendo to release additional projects on the platform.

“We’re continuing to collaborate closely with our friends at Nintendo. We have ‘PGA Tour 2K25’ coming out and ‘WWE 2K26’ [for Switch 2], and we’re incredibly excited about bringing more of our titles to that platform in the future,” said spokesperson Alan Lewis.

Borderlands 4 Content Coming in 2026

Gearbox recently announced the 2026 content coming to Borderlands 4. In addition to the recently released Photo Mode, story updates, the packs, and more are coming to the game throughout this calendar year. Check out the full Roadmap here.

Are you disappointed by this news, or would you prefer the focus to be on the current versions of Borderlands 4? Sound off in our official Discord server.

For more on Take-Two games coming to Nintendo Switch 2, check out the updates coming to WWE 2K26 specifically for the latest Nintendo Switch. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
